answerBox.snippet:
How Do I Adjust Pool Water pH?
 1. If your pool water pH is above 7.8, add an acid such as muriatic acid or sodium bisulfate.
 2. If the pH level is below 7.2, add an alkaline base such as sodium carbonate (soda ash) or sodium bicarbonate (baking soda)

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can I lower the pH in my pool fast?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: To bring down pH, use a made-for-pools chemical additive called pH reducer (or pH minus). The main active ingredients in pH reducers are either muriatic acid or sodium bisulfate (also called dry acid). Reducers are readily available at pool supply stores, home improvement centers and online.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: What Happens if the pH Is Too High in a Pool? - HGTV

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What happens if pH is too high in a pool?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
High pH levels can lead to the formation of scale deposits on pool surfaces and equipment. Scaling occurs when minerals in the water, such as calcium and magnesium, precipitate out of the solution and adhere to surfaces. Over time, these deposits can cause damage to the pool walls, plumbing, and equipment.
Oct 25, 2023

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can I lower the pH in my water quickly?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Simply drop 2-3 drops of lemon juice to an 8 fl oz (240 mL) glass of water. The acidity of a lemon naturally lowers the pH level of the glass of water. You could also just drop a lemon wedge into your water to give a stronger flavor and lower the pH. Lemon juice from a bottle works just as well, too.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: 4 Simple Ways to Lower the pH of Water - wikiHow

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Does baking soda lower pH in pool water?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Baking soda, also known as sodium bicarbonate is naturally alkaline, with a pH of 8. When you add baking soda to your pool water, you will raise both the pH and the alkalinity, improving stability and clarity. Many commercial pool products for raising alkalinity utilize baking soda as their main active ingredient.
